Despite the importance of island biota to global biodiversity, the impact of climate change on insular biodiversity has just begun to be investigated
23, 28, 30â€“ 34 . The few existing studies focused only on species richness, and the lack of knowledge of other biodiversity currencies certainly limits our understanding of this impact. In fact, species richness alone does not provide information regarding certain crucial aspects for species conservation such as evolutionary history
35 . Thus far, we do not know how climate change will impact the tree of life. Will it lead to the loss of deep and/or unique evolutionary branches, or to random pruning? Can we expect a certain tendency towards resilience, as observed on continents
36, 37 ? If so, for what reasons?
